title: Augusta County: Samuel B. Coyner to Mary Anna Sibert, January 20, 1861
summary: Samuel B. Coyner wrote from camp in Hedgesville, (West) Virginia, to one of the "Mt Solon girls," Miss M. A. Sibert. He excuses the tardiness of his letter by describing his injuries sustained in a sleigh ride gone awry. He also asserts the sobriety of his conduct since entering his company and mentions several joint acquaintances.
keywords: Camp Life, Desertion/Leave, Women, American Civil War
